title: Thank You RITO for Ahri's story
body:
I might be a bit biased ,but thank you for not going with the ˝sex-crazed monster˝ style.
Most of the community  was always the opinion that she had to sleep with someone to steal their soul.,which was never confirmed nor denied.

I love the fact that took the approach of monster that wants to be human.The conflict between what you want and what you are.The guilt of taking another life to sustain yours.The emotion you go through,the thing you have to struggle everyday.The remorse you feel.

Not to mention the love story.That was heartbreaking. 
Being a monster learning to love and then finding someone who does.Even after finding out what she was,he still wanted her.
He,taking his life ,makes this even more tragic.

To anyone who wrote story( I assume more people wrote it?) .Thank You.It was breathtaking and You hit the mark on Ahri,how I always imagined her to be. Not a cold blooded killer,but a creature tortured by her nature.Someone with empathy.

It was pretty {{champion:33}} OK {{champion:33}} in my opinion; fundamentally different from what I imagined. Changing from fox to vastaya removes the connection between physical appearance and inner reflection. This is more important than you might think. It makes her less empathetic to me since she's now just getting drunk on memories now instead of choosing between a selfish dream and a growing morality. Now she's just choosing between hunger and morality. While it preserves the theme of self-acceptance, it severely alters the duality between desire and morality. The question "What does it _mean_ to be human?" has just been kicked to the curb. It was also just far too blunt for me.

My criticisms may sound harsh, but that's just because I'm focusing on the negatives. It's got some good points too; the parallel between flowers was decent though a bit artificial. It's a different direction from what I've always imagined, so I give it an {{champion:33}} OK {{champion:33}}.
